LUQAbdomen.title: Abdominal pain - left upper quadrant (LUQ)
differential: Gastric causes (dyspepsia, gastritis, gastric ulcer, volvulus and gastric outlet obstruction, postoperative complication from gastric bypass or gastric banding)
Splenic causes (splenomegaly, splenic infarct and sickle cell crisis, splenic abscess, splenic rupture, ruptured splenic artery aneurysm, splenic torsion, splenic vein thrombosis)

Pancreatitis and it's complications (pseudocysts and fluid collections, intrasplenic pseudocysts or haemorrhage or infarct, gastric wall, colonic spasm or obstruction and adynamic ileus, pseudoaneurysm of the splenic artery, splenic vein thrombosis)
Left kidney causes (renal colic, pyelonephritis and renal abscess)
Pulmonary causes (left lower lobe pneumonia, pulmonary embolus)
Colonic splenic flexure (colitis and ischaemic colitis, diverticulitis, carcinoma, splenic flexure syndrome)
Jejunal causes (jejunal obstruction and internal hernias, jejunal diverticulitis)
Musculoskeletal causes (muscular structures, slipping rib syndrome)
References: radiology article on causes, Cope's early diagnosis of the acute abdomen and own knowledge

abdominalWall.title: Abdominal wall pain - positive Carnett sign
differential: Rectus nerve entrapment (anterior cutraneous nerve entrapment)
Abdominal wall tear and intra-abdominal wall adhesions

uterineBleeding.title: Abnormal uterine bleeding
differential: Contraceptive related abnormal bleeding (oral contraceptives, depo-medroxyprogesterone, intrauterine device, progestin implant)
Normal variations (postmenarchal, perimenopausal, premenstrual spotting, postmenstrual spotting, midcycle ovulatory bleeding)
Organ failure (late manifestation: kidney failure, liver failure)

achilles.title: Achilles region pain
differential: Midportion achillles tendinopathy (this includes tendinosis, paratendonitis, and partial tears
Insertional achilles tendinopathy (including retrocalcaneal bursitis and haglund's disease)

persistentAnkle.title: Ankle pain (persistent following injury)
differential: Fractures - anterior process calcaneus, lateral process talus, posterior process talus (or, rare, os trigonum fracture), osteochondral lesion, tibial plafond chondral lesion, base of fifth metatarsal
Atypical sprains - chronic ligamentous instability, medial ligament sprain, syndesmosis sprain (AITFL sprain), subtalar joint sprain
Tendon injuries - chronic peroneal tendon weakness, peroneal tendon subluxation/rupture, tibialis posterior tendon subluxation/rupture
Other - inadequate rehabiliation, chronic synovitis, sinus tarsi syndrome, complex regional pain syndrome type 1

lateralAnkle.title: Ankle pain (lateral)
differential: Referred pain (lumbar, peroneal nerve, superior tibiofibular joint)
?Complex regional pain syndrome type 1 (following knee or ankle injury)

medialAnkle.title: Ankle pain (medial)
differential: ?Complex regional pain syndrome type 1 (following knee or ankle injury)

arthralgia.title: Arthralgias
differential: Viremia (nonspecific, infectious mononucleosis, hepatitis, cytomegalovirus, fifth disease, rubella, mumps, varicella, human immunodeficiency virus)

backPainChildren.title: Back Pain in Children
differential: Inflammatory spondyloarthropathies (ankylosing spondylitis, inflammatory bowel disease, reactive arthritis)

breastPain.title: Breast pain (mastalgia)
differential: Drugs (antibiotics, antidepressants, antipsychotics, estrogen, progesterone, clomiphene, antihypertensives, metronidazole, ketoconazole, spironolactone)

calfPain.title: Calf Pain
differential: Referred pain (lumbar spine, myofascial structures, superior tibiofibular joint, baker's cyst, knee posterior cruciate ligament, knee posterior capsular sprain)
Vascular entrapment (popliteal artery, endofibrosis of external iliac artery)
Stress fractures (fibula, posterior cortex of the tibia)

chestPainPleuritic.title: Chest Pain - Pleuritic
differential: Musculoskeletal - Rib fracture/sprain, Costochondritis, Vertebral Pathology, Tietze's syndrome, Precordial Catch Syndrome

constipation.title: Constipation
differential: Medications (anticholinergics. antidepressants, antipsychotics, opiates, iron, calcium channel blockers)

cough.title: Cough
differential: *Drugs (angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors, beta blockers, amiodarone)

cryingInfant.title: Crying infant (Inconsolable)
differential: ?Infections (otitis media, viral illness, urinary tract infection, herpes stomatitis, meningitis, osteomyelitis, septic joint, thrush)

cyclicalVomiting.title: Cyclical Vomiting
differential: Small bowel: intermittent small bowel obstruction, chronic intestinal pseudo-obstruction, malrotation with volvulus
Metabolic: Adrenocorticoid insufficiency, acute intermittent porphyria

delirium.title: Delirium
differential: ?Central nervous system infections (neurosyphilis, human immunodeficiency virus, herpes simplex)

diarrhoea.title: Diarrhoea
differential: *Drugs (antibiotics, caffeine, alcohol, magnesium, aminosalicylaes, NSAIDs, beta blockers, digoxin)
Bacterial overgrowth (e.g., diabetes, blind loop after surgery)
Malignancy (colon, ovarian, carcinoid, pancreatic endocrine tumours [VIPoma, gastrinoma, somastisatinoma, PET releasing calcitonin, glucagonoma] thyroid medullary carcinoma, systemic mastocytosis)

dizziness.title: Dizziness, ill-defined
differential: *Drugs (antihypertensives, antidepressants, gentamicin, furosemide, alcohol, illicit drugs)
Barotrauma, ruptured oval window, perilymph leak

earPain.title: Ear pain, otalgia
differential: Acute otitis media, otitis media with effusion
External otitis or external canal pustule

flushing.title: Flushing
differential: Physiologic: Menopause, Hot drinks, Emotional distress, Anaphylaxis
Drugs: Alcohol, alcohol plus chlorpromazine or disulfram, diltiazem, amyl nitrate, nicotininc acid (niacin), levodopa, bromocriptine

Diseases: Hyperthyroidism, Carcinoid syndrome, Systemic mastocytosis, Basophilic chronic granulocytic leukemia, VIPoma, Pheochromocytoma, Medullary carcinoma of the thyroid, Renal cell carcinoma, Diencephalic seizures, Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome (POTS)

oedemaLeg.title: Oedema, leg
differential: Obstructive sleep apnoea (resulting in pulmonary hypertension)
*Drugs (NSAIDS, Ca channel blockers, steroids, antidepressants, beta blockers, clonidine, estrogen/progesterone)

lateralElbow.title: Elbow pain (lateral)
differential: Referred pain (Cervical spine, Upper thoracic spine, Neuro-myofascial )
Posterior interosseous nerve entrapment (radial tunnel syndrome)

medialElbow.title: Elbow pain (medial)
differential: Medial collateral ligament sprain (acute and chronic)
Avulsion fracture of the medial epicondyle (children and adolescents)

eyelidSwelling.title: Eyelid swelling
differential: Systemic processes (myxedema, renal disease, congestive heart failure, superior vena cava syndrome)

facialFlushing.title: Facial flushing, hot flashes
differential: Drugs (calcium-channel blockers, nicotinic acid, levodopa, others)
Foods (spicy foods, cured meats, monosodium glutamate)

fatigue.title: Fatigue, malaise, vague symptoms
differential: ?*Infections (infectious mononucleosis, hepatitis, pneumonia, mastitis, urosepsis, cytomegalovirus, tuberculosis, endocarditis, human immunodeficiency syndrome, Lyme, Coccidiomycosis, Giardia)

fever.title: Fever (acute, uncertain source)
differential: ?Infections (pulmonary, gastrointestinal, urinary, sinusitis, skin, meningitis, bone, infectious mononucleosis, Lyme, cytomegalovirus, occult abscess, human Immunodeficiency virus, malaria, mastitis, West Nile, endocarditis, leptospirosis, tuberculosis, hepatitis)
?*Malignancy, tumor lysis syndrome (lymphoma, leukemia, renal cell, liver)
Periodic fever syndromes (PFAPA -periodic fever with aphthous stomatitis, pharyngitis and adenitis), Familial Mediterranean Fever, others)

rearFoot.title: Foot (rear foot) and heel pain
differential: *Regional complex pain syndrome type 1 (after knee or ankle surgery)

midFoot.title: Foot (mid foot) pain
differential: Stress fractures (navicular most common, less common cuneiform, cuboid, base second metatarsal)
?Complex regional pain syndrome type 1 (after knee or ankle surgery)

foreFoot.title: Foot (fore foot) pain
differential: Stress fractures (second and third most common), sesamoid
?Complex regional pain syndrome type 1 (after knee or ankle surgery)

hairLoss.title: Hair Loss
differential: Medications (anticoagulants, anticonvulsants, hormones, antilipid agents, antihypertensives)

haematuria.title: Haematuria
differential: Glomerular disease (IgA nephropathy, hereditary nephritis, postinfectious glomerulonephritis)
Papillary necrosis (nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug overuse, diabetes, sickle cell)

hipPainLateral.title: Hip pain (lateral)
differential: Greater trochanteric pain syndrome (Gluteus medius dysfunction, Gluteus medius or gluteus minimus tendinopathy, Piriformis tendinopathy, Iliotibial tract friction syndrome, Trochanteric bursitis )

insomnia.title: Insomnia, sleep disturbance
differential: Medications, substances (caffeine, nicotine, pseudoephedrine, cocaine, steroids, alcohol, others)
Nocturia (diuretics, prostate hypertrophy, diabetes, incontinence, heart failure)

legPain.title: Leg pain, bone pain, extremity pain
differential: ?*Fracture, trauma, stress fracture (medial tibia, anterior tibia, fibula)
Chronic exertional compartment syndrome (anterior, lateral, deep posterior, superficial posterior)

coma.title: Mental status, acute change (coma, lethargy)
differential: ?Disturbance of Ca, Mg, Na, K, P

mouthPain.title: Mouth pain, burning mouth, burning tongue
differential: Xerostomia (drugs, connective tissue disease, old age, Sjogrens, radiation therapy, chemotherapy)
?Nutritional deficiencies (vitamin B12, iron, folate, zinc, vitamin B6)

muscleCramp.title: Muscle cramps
differential: *Medications (nifedipine, inhaled beta agonists, thiazides, beta blockers, cisplatin, vincristine, oral contraceptives, others)
Lower motor neuron (injury, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis,

neckMass.title: Neck mass
differential: Reactive viral lymphadenopathy (upper respiratory infection, infectious mononucleosis, cytomegalovirus)
Suppurative bacterial lymphadenopathy (strep throat, skin infection)
Systemic disease (sarcoid, Sj'gren, Kimura, Castleman, Rosai-Dorfman)

pruritis.title: Pruritus
differential: *Drugs (narcotics, calcium channel blocker, hydrochlorothiazide, angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors, salicylates, chloroquine, allergic reaction, cholestasis, amphetamines, cocaine)
Neuropathic pruritus (diabetic neuropathy, genital neural impingement)

rashGeneralised.title: Rash, generalised
differential: Viral exanthem Swimmer's itch, Seabather's eruption

rinorrhoea.title: Rhinorrhoea, nasal congestion
differential: Medications (estrogen, progesterone, aspirin, nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs, clonidine, prazosin, doxazosin, beta blockers, calcium channel blockers, thiazides, angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors, erectile dysfunction drugs, amitriptyline, risperidone, gabapentin)

seizure.title: Seizure and seizure mimics
differential: Imitators (vasovagal syncope, pseudoseizures (now called psychogenic nonepileptic events), transient ischemic attack, arrhythmia, migraine)

shoulder.title: Shoulder pain
differential: Shoulder joint disease (rotator cuff tendinopathy, bicipital tendinitis, labral tear, adhesive capsulitis, glenohumeral arthritis, acromioclavicular joint arthritis, labral tear)

sinusTachycardia.title: Sinus tachycardia
differential: *Drugs (alcohol, amitriptyline, amphetamines, anticholinergics, beta blocker withdrawal, bupropion, caffeine, cilostazol, cocaine, ephedrine, epinephrine, isoproterenol, nicotine)

sweating.title: Sweating, excessive, hyperhidrosis, night sweats
differential: *Drugs (antidepressants, triptans, antipyretics, tamoxifen, raloxifene, alcohol, beta blockers, calcium channel blockers, omeprazole, opioids, tramadol, insulin, sulfonylureas, niacin, sildenafil)

syncope.title: Syncope, near syncope
differential: Vasovagal (emotion, pain, fear, prolonged standing, heat,

tremour.title: Tremour
differential: Medications (bronchodilators, caffeine, steroids, lithium, sympathomimetics, antipsychotics, metoclopramide, tricyclics, valproic acid)

vertigo.title: Vertigo
differential: ?Drugs (gentamicin, furosemide, phenytoin, aminoglycosides, diazepam, aspirin, alcohol)

weakness.title: Weakness
differential: Drugs (cocaine, heroin, alcohol, corticosteroids, colchicine, antimalarial drugs, statins)

wristAcute.title: Wrist pain (acute)
differential: Distal radius fracture (often intra-articular in the athlete)

Dorsal wrist pain - Scaphoid fracture, Scaphoid impaction syndrome, Fracture dislocation of carpus, Lunate fracture, Distal radius fracture, Scapholunate ligament tear, Kienbock's disease (acute onset), Lunotriquetralligament tear, Distal radioulnar joint injury, Carpometacarpal dislocation
Volar wrist pain - Carpal instability, Hook of hamate fracture

wristSubacuteDorsal.title: Wrist pain (subacute) - dorsal
differential: Dorsal pole of lunate and distal radius impingement (gymnasts)
Extensor pollicis longus impingement on Lister's tubercle (occasional rupture)

wristSubacuteRadial.title: Wrist pain (subacute) - radial
differential: Dorsal pole of lunate impingement on distal radius (gymnasts)
